p: In this research, the ethanol crude extract from Tagetes erecta flower showed the highest inhibitory effect on MSSA (0.78 mg/ml), MRSA (3.13 mg/ml), K. pneumoniae (1.25 mg/ml), and P. aeruginosa (2.5 mg/ml), in comparison with other extracts. Recently, many reports demonstrated that the extracts of Tagetes erecta inhibited S. aureus, P. aeruginosa, K. pneumoniae, and P. mirabilis [ 37– 39]. Padalia and Chanda (2015) reported MIC values on those bacteria in the range of 62–1250 μg/ml [ 37].
